thread.title: Laura Citarella's 'Dog Lady' to screen at Jio Mami-Mumbai Film Festival
thread.title_full: Laura Citarella's 'Dog Lady' to screen at Jio Mami-Mumbai Film Festival - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Laura Citarella's 'Dog Lady' to screen at Jio Mami-Mumbai Film Festival
text:
The Jio MAMI Mumbai Film Festival is an inclusive movie feast. It will be showcasing the latest cutting-edge, independent cinema from allaroound the world. It offers the best of world cinema to the people of Mumbai.
The festival is run by the Mumbai Academy of Moving Image popularly known as MAMI. Their goal is to nurture and ignite a passion for movies.
For the latest in Hollywood news, like us on Facebook >>> TOIEntertain
For latest Hollywood updates follow us on Twitter >>> @TOIEntertain
For the first time ever The Consulate of Argenitna has got down an Argentine Director specially for this prestigious festival. Her name is Laura Citarella, she will be the only Latin American director to be coming down for Jio MAMI 2015, where her recent work Dog Lady , (La Mujer de los Perros) will be screened in the World Cinema section during the festival.
About the Film Dog Lady
This mute production has been jointly directed by Laura and the argentine actress and protagonist Veronica Llinas. It follows a woman living a self-imposed, vagabond existence with a pack of dogs on the edge of Buenos Aires. The film follows this hermit across four seasons as she patches up her makeshift shack in the woods, communes with nature, and forages for (and sometimes steals) food, making only the briefest of forays into the city and only fleetingly engaging with other people. Dog Lady is filmed with an attentive and sympathetic eye, yet it is careful never to explain its subject.
For more interesting Hollywood news and pictures follow us on Pinterest>>> timesofindia
For latest Hollywood updates follow us on G+ >>> The Times of India Entertainment
About Laura Citarella
Laura Citarella (1981) is a member of the production company El Pampero Cine, along with Mariano Llinas, Alejo Moguillansky and Agustin Mendilaharzu. In 2006 she won the Historias breves 5 contest and in 2008 she made the short film Tres Juntos . She produced, among other films, Extraordinary Stories (2008) and Castro (2009). Ostende (2011) was her first feature film.
Her most recent work, Dog Lady , premiered at the 2015 BFI London Film Festival on October 8.
She will be down for the festival from the 2nd of Nov, 2015 to the 6th of Nov,2015, hence if you'd like to do an online interview or would like to meet her personally , please let me know and I will have this arranged.
